metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19722 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Dovecot before 2.3.9.2, an attacker can crash a push-notification driver with a crafted email when push notifications are used, because of a NULL Pointer Dereference. The email must use a group address as either the sender or the recipient.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19722` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Only affects 2.3.9 according to upstream - original fix was incomplete so required extra fix in 2.3.9.2 release

criterions.comment: dovecot package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.22-1ubuntu2.12').
